div.h3: Summerville Elementary School Parent Communicator - April 3, 2020

div.span: Dear Summerville Elementary Parents and Students,
We have a very important update regarding our current school facility closure. Please see the press release from TCOSO below as well as the links from our school district.
PRESS RELEASE TCSOS: "School facilities in Tuolumne County will remain closed for the remainder of the 19/20 school
year. Distance Learning for the remainder of the 2019-20 School Year will be in effect. It is important to understand we
are not ending the school year and we are continuing the essential work of teaching and learning for all Tuolumne
County public school students."
Video Message from the superintendent: bit.ly/SumEl-V-Communicator-4-3-2020

span.strong: Update Parent Communicator Letter from the superintendent:

div.span: We also encourage you to read the full press release about this county-wide decision at the following link: https://bit.ly/3bQgx2Y

We anticipate that all of our families will have many questions about school over the next few weeks. Though we do not have all of the answers now, we plan to provide weekly Parent Communicator updates in order to address this immediate change as well as plans moving into the future.
Thank you.
Ben Howell - Superintendent, Summerville Elementary School District
Summerville Elementary School District

div.h3: Summerville Elementary School Parent Communicator - March 31, 2020

div.div: Dear Summerville Elementary Parents and Staff,

After careful consideration and guidance from the County Health Department and our State resources, Summerville Elementary School District has made the decision to extend our school closure through Friday, May 1, 2020. We made this decision out of an abundance of caution and to support the health and wellbeing of our students and families during this pivotal time in our history.

div.span: During this time, it is important that each family continue to observe the shelter in place directions put in place by our state and local officials earlier this month. By taking these proactive measures, we each can do our part to help slow the spread of the coronavirus in Tuolumne County. Please continue to practice the guidance published by our CDC and our local health officials: practice social distancing, wash your hands regularly, limit your travel to necessary and essential locations, contact your healthcare provider if you are experiencing symptoms such as fever cough, or difficulty breathing. By observing these measures, we can each do our part to mitigate this virus in our area.

During our extended closure, we will continue to provide food service on Mondays and Wednesdays between 11:00 am and 12:30 pm. All Summerville Elementary students are eligible to participate in our extended food service program. Please contact our school office at 209-928-4291 x1 or by emailing jhall@sumel.org for more information. Classroom enrichment activities will continue to be provided by our teaching staff during this closure. Please look for more information from your student's teacher in the coming days.

At this time, school is scheduled to resume on Monday, May 4, 2020. We recognize that this extension creates many questions. We plan to address each of these questions as we learn more information and receive more guidance from the state and our local officials. If you have a specific question about your student we encourage you to reach out to your student's teacher. If you have a school-wide question, please reach out to our district office. We plan to be in regular communication over the next few weeks. Please look for Summerville Elementary Parent Communicator Updates in your email inbox, on our school website, and our social media channels
Thank you for working together to make our community a great place to learn and grow! "Together, we can make a difference!"
- Ben Howell, Superintendent & Principal, Summerville Elementary School
Summerville Elementary School District

div.h3: Summerville Elementary School Parent Communicator - March 17 2020

div.div: Dear Summerville Elementary Parents and Staff,

Beginning Wednesday of this week (3-18-2020). Our cafeteria staff will be providing meals to any student in need of breakfast or lunch. We plan to provide this service until our scheduled Spring Break (3-20-2020). For students who live within a mile of the campus (the Tuolumne City area). Food will be available for pick up between the hours of 11:00 am and 12:30 pm in the front of the school. For students who live further away from campus. Food will be available for drop off at bus stop locations at designated times. If your student is interested in this foodservice option please contact the school’s main office at 209-928-4291 x4291 or by emailing jhall@sumel.org .

div.p: Please contact the school tomorrow so we can begin making plans for distribution.
Additionally, if you have any other questions, we encourage you to reach out to our main office.

div.div: - Summerville Elementary School Cafeteria Staff

div.span: Summerville Elementary School District

div.h3: Summerville Elementary School Parent Communicator - March 16, 2020

div.div: Dear Summerville Elementary Parents and Staff,

div.p: Please see the link below to view our Parent Communicator for Monday, March 16, 2020:

Beginning Wednesday, March 18, we will be putting in place a breakfast and lunch food service option for our students. Please see the parent communicator linked above or contact our school office tomorrow for more information.
Thanks.
- Summerville Elementary School District Office

div.span: Summerville Elementary School District

div.h3: Summerville Elementary School Parent Communicator - March 15, 2020

div.span: Dear Summerville Elementary Parents and Staff,

Working in conjunction with the Tuolumne County Superintendent of School and the other districts in Tuolumne County. Summerville Elementary School will be closed from March 16, 2020, until after the scheduled Spring Break. At this time, school is scheduled to resume on March 30, 2020.
For more information, please see this press release from the Tuolumne County Superintendent of Schools: http://bit.ly/38UfnSa

At this time, all campus activities are suspended including the after school program, after school sports, and school trips. We will provide you with more information throughout the week regarding ways that we are planning to support our students during this closure event.
We encourage you to click on this link to view the full message from our district superintendent: http://bit.ly/SumElCommunicator3-15-2020
It is our goal to ensure we have a healthy and safe school environment for all of our students. If you have any questions, we encourage you to contact our school office.
Thank you for working hard to make a community a great place to learn and grow! "Together, we can make a difference!"
Ben Howell - Superintendent & Principal, Summerville Elementary School District
Summerville Elementary School District

div.h3: Summerville Elementary School Parent Communicator - March 12, 2020

div.p: Dear Summerville Elementary Parents and Staff,

As news regarding the coronavirus (COVID-19) continues to develop across our region, we wanted to provide you with an update regarding the school’s plan to help maintain a healthy and safe school campus. Please click on the following link to read this week's Parent Communicator Update from our superintendent.
We encourage you to contact our school office tomorrow if you have any questions.
It is our goal to ensure we have a healthy and safe school environment for all of our students. If you have any questions, we encourage you to contact our school office.
Thank you for working hard to make a community a great place to learn and grow! "Together, we can make a difference!"

div.span: Summerville Elementary School District

div.h3: Summerville Elementary School Parent Communicator - March 3, 2020

div.p: Dear Summerville Elementary Parents and Staff,

With information developing across the region and the state about the Coronavirus (COVID-19), our school district would like to provide our parents and staff information about how we are preparing our school for a healthy and safe Spring Season. Please click on the link below to see a message from our district superintendent:
It is our goal to ensure we have a healthy and safe school environment for all of our students. If you have any questions, we encourage you to contact our school office tomorrow.
Thank you for working hard to make a community a great place to learn and grow! "Together, we can make a difference!"

div.span: Summerville Elementary School District

a.span: Summerville Elementary 2019 School Accountability Report Card CDE.pdf
Food Service Operations - Meal Payment Policy E 3551.doc

p.strong: to Summerville Elementary School. Home of the Beavers!

div.p: Summerville Elementary is a rural county school in Tuolumne City, located in the beautiful foothills of California. Our Kindergarten through Eighth-grade programs offers our community exceptional education support in a loving, nurturing, community-based environment. As a school, we believe that "Together, we can make a difference!"

We invite you to explore our site and learn more about the wonderful things that are happening at our school. Working together, we are making a difference in the lives of each child. We are confident our students will grow to lead in our community to do great things in this generation and in the generations to come.
- Ben Howell, Superintendent & Principal - Summerville Elementary School District

span.span: Click on the lightbulb for distance learning.

div.p: Kindergarten Registration at Summerville Elementary School 2020

img.style: display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;

div.p: PTSA email address is: summervilleptsa@gmail.com

img.style: display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;

div.p: Dixie Cups
Baggies - Snack Size
Boys & Girls "New" underwear Size 4-10
Keurig Coffee K Cups
Any and All Craft Supplies or Office Supplies
CA State law requires all students to have "ALL IMMUNIZATIONS" up to date before they can attend any school in California.

p.strong: Please bring all proof of all updated immunizations to our office as soon as possible.

div.p: Below is the link to the current draft of the LCAP. Please email bhowell@sumel.org if you have any questions or comments. The Board of Trustees held a Public Hearing on June 4 to gather public comment. The final draft was approved by the Board on June 12 2019.

a.title: 2019 Local Control Accountability Plan Annual Summerville Elementary School.pdf

p.a: 2019 Local Control Accountability Plan Annual Summerville Elementary School.pdf

img.style: display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;
img.title: Kinder Registration.png

div.div:
Attention All Current and Future Summerville Elementary Parents,
Kindergarten Registration is quickly approaching!
Please see the important link below regarding Kindergarten Registration:
https://bit.ly/SumElKinderReg2020
Kinder Registration Paperwork is available by contacting our front office (pick up on Monday or Wednesday between 11:00 am and 12:30 pm) or by visiting our school website: www.sumel.k12.ca.us
Paperwork "drive-by dropoff" will be in the Summerville Elementary School Parking lot on Friday, Apri 24, 2020, between 10:00 am and 3:00 pm. Late paperwork "drive-by dropoff" will be on Friday, May 1, 2020, between 10:00 am and 3:00 pm.
Please help us spread the word!
